front.title: Preventing Fragmentation for Client Initiated Connections in the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP)

abstract.t: There is cases when a Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) client can initiate a bidirectional UDP stream or a TCP connection to a SIP server but the SIP server cannot do the same in the other direction. The server can reuse the existing bidirectional UDP stream or TCP connection but cannot use a TCP connection if the client chose to use a bidirectional UDP stream. This document described a method to force the client to initiate a TCP connection to the server.
